meanings.definition: The right-hand page of an open book.
meanings.sent1: I always prefer to read the text on the rectos of the book.
meanings.sent2: She carefully turned the page to reveal the rectos.
meanings.sent3: The rectos of the book seemed to be hiding a secret message.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes scanned the rectos as if searching for hidden treasure.
meanings.sent5: The colorful illustrations on the rectos made the story come alive.

meanings.definition: Plural form of recto, meaning the front side of a leaf of paper.
meanings.sent1: The teacher handed out the rectos of the worksheets first.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to write your name on all the rectos of the paper.
meanings.sent3: The pile of rectos on the desk looked like a mountain of information.
meanings.sent4: She flipped through the rectos quickly, searching for the answer.
meanings.sent5: The neat handwriting on the rectos made it easy to follow along.
